channel.title: Replication cost
channel.description:
I am interested in replicating the TopBar design. But I'm a total noob at applying myself to fabrication.
Here in Seattle there is a [maker space business][1] that charges $3/min for laser cutting. Is using a laser cutter rather than cnc router appropriate? Does anyone have an estimate of how much time it would take to cut the pieces?
From a different route, if I was to get a [ShapeOko][2] cnc router could the beehive be cut with it, or is the ShapeOko cutting space too small?
Thanks!
[1]: http://www.metrixcreatespace.com/rates/ [2]: http://www.shapeoko.com/

item.title: Replication cost at 2014-03-22 16:13:09 -0400
item.description:
Marcus (marcus) wrote:

I am interested in replicating the TopBar design. But I'm a total noob at applying myself to fabrication.

Here in Seattle there is a maker space business that charges $3/min for laser cutting. Is using a laser cutter rather than cnc router appropriate? Does anyone have an estimate of how much time it would take to cut the pieces?

From a different route, if I was to get a ShapeOko cnc router could the beehive be cut with it, or is the ShapeOko cutting space too small?

Thanks!
